intro: Agapetes setigera, commonly known as the silverleaf agapete, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair, giving it a silvery appearance. It produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. Agapetes setigera is often found growing in cool, moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
